title: American Scout Seamount
text: American Scout Seamount appeared on <a href="Nautical%20chart">charts</a> of the <a href="North%20Atlantic%20ocean">North Atlantic Ocean</a> published during the 1950s. It was located near with a depth of 37 meters. Investigations by the <a href="Woods%20Hole%20Oceanographic%20Institution">Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution</a> research vessel "<a href="RV%20Atlantis%20II">Atlantis II</a>" in 1964 found no evidence that it existed. Extensive surveys by the <a href="U.S.%20Naval%20Oceanographic%20Office">U.S. Naval Oceanographic Office</a> eventually disproved the existence of a seamount in the vicinity. A June 1966 bathymetric and magnetic survey by the new survey ship found no evidence of a seamount with no soundings less than but did find strong returns from the <a href="Deep%20Scattering%20Layer">Deep Scattering Layer</a> that could be mistaken for shoals.
